subject: Re: [junit] Please suggest a book on Junit for beginners
msgSnippet: ... FWIW, I wrote a So you d like to... page on Amazon that describes the books that I used to learn unit testing. In a nutshell, I started with the
messageBody:
> I am very new to Junit testing. I have very basic JAVA programming
> experience. I appreciate if you can suggest a book on Junit for
> beginners.

FWIW, I wrote a "So you'd like to..." page on Amazon that describes the
books that I used to learn unit testing. In a nutshell, I started with
the Pragmatic Programmers' /Pragmatic Unit Testing/, moved up to /Unit
Testing in Java/ (which wasn't so great), and found nerdvana in J.B.
Rainsberger's /JUnit in Action/.

http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/guides/guide-display/-/3AMLIJODJKEDI/

(Note the pedants out there: this isn't a plug; I removed my referrer
info from the link.)
